lines.text: [about sex]
I don't know. Sometimes it seems like such a strange sort of thing to want to do. You know, ridiculous. Like someone putting their finger up your nose or something.
You mustn't mess me about. I know I may look like a rhinoceros, but I've got quite a thin skin really.
[Eve and Aidan are playing draughts. Aidan wins]
All right then, you win. What do I have to do?
You've got to hold it in your hand... for sixty seconds.
All right, I'll hold it. But I won't diddle it about, d'you understand?
[Last line, delivered happily after sex with Jack]
Bless me father, for I have sinned!
You really know who you are, don't you?
Well, yes, of course I do.
Knockglen for the rest of your life and married to Sean bloody Walsh!" I'd rather be married to a bloody lizard!
I don't care what the priests say. I think we should do as we feel.
He could have anyone at all. Why would he look at me?
I could love you again, but I don't think I want to.
Have... have you ever gone all the way with a girl?
No. Not quite.
Would you like to?
Now?
No. It wasn't an invitation - just a request for information.
Jesus, Mary and Joseph, I look like the prow of a ship!
[first lines]
When all this started, all our families have lived in Knockglen for as long as anybody could remember. And in Ireland people have very long memories.
Oh, God, Nan. You must have realised I must marry for money. We lose the house, the whole family goes down. I can't afford to marry you now, however much I'd want to.

[about Sean Walsh]
Oh, God! He's like a lizard!
Oh, how do you think lizards make love?
